poem:
### Dawn of Defenses

NATO whispers to the West,  
air teems with the residue  
of invisible wings—  
meeting with missiles,  
like iron whispers over Ukraine.  
Raytheon's bolts of sky  
pause anxiously over a map,  
unfolded by tomorrow's hand,  
while leaders confer  
beneath the gallop of clouds,  
an armistice of sharp shadows.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nato looks to bolster defences in response to Russian air incursions – Europe live 10.00am BST Senior Ukrainian officials visiting the United States said Wednesday that they met with representatives of US weapon manufacturers, including Raytheon, which produces Tomahawk missiles that Washington could provide to Kyiv, Agence France-Presse (AFP) reports. The Ukrainian delegation’s two-day visit also included talks with senior US officials and comes ahead of a planned meeting between US President Donald Trump and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
